text:
Hello <@U04G8JEFND8>

You can create the global module. The global module is the best choice .

Hello <@UATE4ATHP>

I think you are not selecting the theme page. So the modules of the theme are not visible.
No I was, I talked with HS and It was a bug
This is global content. I can see my theme modules

Hey guys. I'm trying to add a custom font to a child theme of a theme the client purchased. Currently referring to <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/themes/custom-fonts|this documentation> for the steps, but when I get to the theme preview, I'm able to select the font in the typography dropdown, but it doesn't necessarily get applied and uses the fallback font or something. I've double-checked the naming and font path in the font.json and theme.json files, but nada. Any ideas?
You should be able to just add your @font-face declarations to the child.css and then use the :root to redefine the variables

Thanks <@U03AKL6Q1B2>! Yes, I was able to get it to work after having seen <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Blog-Website-Page-Publishing/Child-theme-CSS-for-custom-font-a-puzzle-that-needs-help/m-p/722838|this thread>. I don't quite follow what you mean by using :root to redefine the variables?
This was 2 months ago. Its been fixed
Update: we're actually encountering bugs when setting multiple elements to the custom font using the theme settings editor.
does the theme provider have documentation for how to configure custom fonts with their theme? they may not be using the root definitions

Unfortunately, I can't find any documentation from them. Also looked around the theme and don't see any :root.

Is there any guide on how to add custom fonts that users can select from the theme editor itself? I mean, from the dropdown. I'm either missing something or <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/themes/custom-fonts|this guide> doesn't quite apply to child themes
Currently, here's what I have set up. I can select the Gilroy font from the dropdown, it's just not taking effect
and did you already load the font files to the child.css?

I’m running into an issue with a theme I’m building out for a client right now — for some reason, the font selected in the theme’s options isn’t applying, but *only* in the page builder view and *only* on their account.

On published pages, in page previews, and in the theme settings menu, it’s showing up just fine. On my development environment, it’s working 100% as expected, including in the page builder.

If I poke around with the element inspector, I see an empty value where the font name should be. I’m frankly a little stumped — it feels like it can’t be my fault given the incredibly specific context in which it fails, but I’m welcome to any and all suggestions as to how I might be able to solve it.
